author: Josh Wingrove, Joe Deaux, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump formally opened the door to approving Nippon Steel Corp.’s purchase of United States Steel Corp., the latest milestone in the long-running saga over the sale of an iconic American firm.
title: Trump Submits Proposed Security Agreement for US Steel Sale

author: Alberto Nardelli, Ben Bartenstein, Josh Wingrove
description: The US isn’t budging from its opposition to a lower price cap on Russian oil sales, people familiar with the matter said, dampening European hopes that leaders meeting for a Group of Seven summit in Canada will agree to a cut.
title: US Opposes European Push to Lower G-7 Price Cap on Russian Oil

author: Nicolle Yapur
description: Colombia activated an “escape clause” to suspend borrowing limits as the finance ministry forecasts the widest fiscal deficit since the pandemic.
title: Colombia Activates Fiscal ‘Escape Clause’ and Plans Tax Hike

author: Josh Sisco
description: President Donald Trump is preparing to nominate Melissa Holyoak, a Republican on the Federal Trade Commission, to be the US Attorney for Utah, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Trump Eyes Nominating FTC Commissioner for Utah US Attorney

author: Akayla Gardner
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Confronts Sudden Upheavals at Home and Abroad

author: Kelcee Griffis, Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump has intervened to push EchoStar Corp. and Federal Communications Commission Chairman Brendan Carr to resolve a dispute over the satellite communications company’s valuable spectrum licenses. EchoStar shares surged more than 50% in postmarket trading on Friday.
title: Trump Urged Ergen, Carr to Cut a Deal on EchoStar Spectrum

author: Alicia Clanton
description: Missouri Governor Mike Kehoe is activating National Guard troops to support local law enforcement, joining Texas in turning to military personnel ahead of nationwide protests on Saturday against President Donald Trump.
title: Missouri Follows Texas in Activating National Guard for Protests

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei vowed to “act forcefully” and avenge an Israeli military strike on his country that’s so far killed his most senior generals and targeted key nuclear sites.
title: Iran’s Khamenei Vows Revenge on Israel for ‘Starting War’

author: Claire Ballentine, Greg Ryan
description: The program’s academic freedom has been called into question after the Trump administration rejected awards.
title: Fulbright’s Future in Doubt as Trump Targets Elite Scholarship

author: Mishal Husain, David Gura
description: Today on the Big Take: Bloomberg’s Mishal Husain’s exclusive sit down with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: Listen: Bloomberg’s Exclusive Keir Starmer Interview

author: Sarah McGregor
description: US Marines who are part of a military deployment ordered by President Donald Trump began arriving at the Wilshire Federal Building in Los Angeles, positioning them miles away from the areas where protests spurred by immigration raids have taken place.
title: Marines Move Into Los Angeles as Newsom Fights Deployment

author: Ethan Bronner
description: Benjamin Netanyahu has said for three decades that the central threat to Israel’s existence is Iran’s nuclear program. At least twice over that period, he came within inches of carrying out an attack on it.
title: After 30 Years of Hesitation, Netanyahu Pulled the Trigger

author: Keith Laing
description: The Trump administration is taking steps that would make it easier for automakers to deploy-self driving cars without driver controls, a potential boon to the ambitions of Tesla Inc. and rivals looking to put robotaxis on US roads in the near future.
title: US to Ease Rules Hindering Tesla’s Self-Driving Cybercab

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof’s caretaker cabinet agreed to increase defense and security spending to 5% of gross domestic product by 2032 in line with the North Atlantic Treaty Organization’s proposed target.
title: Dutch Cabinet Approves NATO’s 5% Defense Spending Target

author: Myles Miller
description: Four people detained by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement escaped from a privately operated detention facility in Newark, New Jersey, a senior Homeland Security official told Bloomberg News.
title: Four Men Escape From ICE-Contracted Detention Facility in Newark

author: Christoph Rauwald, Isolde MacDonogh
description: German Finance Minister and Vice Chancellor Lars Klingbeil said he’ll support a push to try to break a deadlock on a decade-old European Union effort to deepen the bloc’s capital markets.
title: Germany’s Klingbeil to Support Push to End EU Capital-Markets Impasse

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen
description: The US and Vietnam are closing in on a framework trade agreement, despite ongoing concerns about Chinese goods being rerouted through the Southeast Asian nation to avoid tariffs, according to people familiar with the talks.
title: US, Vietnam Near Trade Framework as Tariff Deadline Approaches

author: Zijia Song
description: New York state lawmakers are within days of a deadline to pass legislation targeting so-called vulture funds that has languished in the local legislature for the past two years.
title: NY Lawmakers Near Deadline to Pass Bill Targeting Emerging Market ‘Vulture Funds’

author: Benjamin Stupples, Alex Wickham, Mishal Husain
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he wants to attract more investors to Britain, even as the nation contends with an exodus of wealthy individuals because of tax hikes.
title: Keir Starmer Says UK Is Luring Top Talent Even as Non-Doms Leave

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Brian Platt
description: The governments of Canada and India are set to establish a new structure to share information about cross-border crimes, their latest step toward rebuilding ties nearly two years after Canadian officials accused India of orchestrating the murder of a Sikh activist near Vancouver.
title: India and Canada Reach Deal to Share Intelligence on Terrorism, Crime

author: Jan-Henrik Foerster
description: The Swiss government approved the country’s new bilateral deal with the European Union, which was hammered out late last year after long negotiations with the bloc.
title: Switzerland’s Government Approves Contentious EU Deal

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: A junior party in the Polish government is working on measures to lower power prices, possibly by freezing them at current levels as well as cutting value-added taxes, according to a person familiar with the plans.
title: Junior Polish Ruling Party Is Working on Reducing Power Prices

author: Alex Wickham, Mishal Husain
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer indicated that the UK was prepared to endorse a new NATO target committing 3.5% of members’ economic output to core defense spending, although he emphasized that key details such as the timeline were still being negotiated.
title: Starmer Signals Support for 3.5% NATO Aim With Talks on Timeline

author: Lydia Beyoud, Gregory Korte, Natalie Wong
description: Even before Donald Trump retook the White House and Elon Musk’s DOGE fanned out across government, the CFTC was on board with reducing its real estate footprint, saving taxpayers millions of dollars.
title: Trump’s Orders Delay CFTC Effort to Get Out of $21 Million Lease

author: Lucy White, Alex Wickham, Mishal Husain
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said there were no “hiccups or obstacles” remaining in the way of finalizing a trade deal with the US and indicated that an agreement would likely come soon.
title: Starmer Says No Obstacles Left in Finalizing US-UK Trade Deal

author: Joe Mayes, Alex Wickham, Mishal Husain
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said the UK has “grave concerns” about Iran’s nuclear program and backed Israel’s right to self-defense, while calling for de-escalation in a conflict that risks engulfing the Middle East.
title: Starmer Says UK Has ‘Grave Concerns’ on Iranian Nuclear Program

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Kim Chipman
description: The Trump administration is proposing oil refiners blend more biofuels into gasoline and diesel next year while seeking to discourage the use of imported supplies.
title: Trump Plans Biofuel Quota Boost, Seeks to Crimp Foreign Supply

author: Daniel Basteiro, Jorge Zuloaga
description: The Spanish government is preparing for a court battle over its opposition to BBVA SA’s takeover bid for smaller lender Banco Sabadell SA, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Spain’s Government Braces for Legal Clash on BBVA’s Sabadell Bid

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Samy Adghirni, Jorge Valero
description: Sweden and the Netherlands are pressing the European Union to sanction members of the Israeli cabinet over the war in Gaza, joining several other nations in the region whose stance on Israel has hardened in recent weeks.
title: Netherlands, Sweden Push for Sanctions Against Israeli Ministers

author: Arun Devnath
description: Bangladesh’s interim leader Muhammad Yunus has indicated that a national election could take place as early as the week before Ramadan begins in February, should reforms advance sufficiently in the coming months.
title: Bangladesh’s Yunus Signals February Vote After Political Talks

author: Marissa Newman, Arsalan Shahla
description: US President Donald Trump urged Iran to accept a nuclear deal to avoid further attacks, hours after Israel bombed the Islamic Republic’s atomic facilities and killed some of its top commanders.
title: Trump Urges Iran to Make a Nuclear Deal to Avoid More Attacks

description: Mark Carney will welcome world leaders to the Canadian Rockies hoping to avoid a repeat of the blow up the last time his country played host
title: Everyone Is Watching Donald Trump: G-7 Leaders Guide

author: Alisha Sachdev
description: India is amenable to relaxing the 50% localization it expects from electric vehicle makers and suppliers in return for incentives, after China’s curbs on rare earths exports put the goal in doubt, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: India Open to Easing EV Rules as China’s Rare Earth Curbs Bite

author: Shery Ahn, Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s Finance Minister said that discussions with market participants is a key factor in making sure that government bonds are bought and sold stably, as the ministry neared a closely watched gathering with investors.
title: Japan’s Kato Says Talks With Markets Key for Bond Issuance

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesian and South Korean officials have signed a revised deal that significantly lowers Jakarta’s financial commitment to the joint KF-21 fighter jet program, a move aimed at reviving long-stalled progress on the multibillion-dollar project.
title: South Korea Agrees to Cut Indonesia Share in Fighter Jet Project

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Alisha Sachdev
description: Indian officials discussed China’s rare earth restrictions during talks with that country’s vice foreign minister this week, people familiar with the matter said, as automakers continue to warn of a looming shortage that may disrupt output in the South Asian nation.
title: India, China Tackle Rare Earth Curbs in Meeting of Top Officials

author: Rachel Adams-Heard, Sophie Alexander, Fola Akinnibi
description: The Trump administration has tapped 41 vendors to compete for lucrative federal contracts.
title: As Part of a $45 Billion Push, ICE Prepares for a Vast Expansion of Detention Space

author: Lionel Laurent
description: The upcoming conclave in Canada may be the rare space to find common ground, even as the forum itself is looking increasingly outmoded.
title: Wrecking Ball Trump Makes the G-7 More Necessary

author: Norman Harsono, Claire Jiao
description: Indonesia will no longer send a delegation to the US for tariff negotiations as its proposal to Washington has already been deemed sufficient, according to the senior minister who’s leading the talks.
title: Indonesia Scraps Plan to Send Delegation to US for Tariff Talks

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran has faced suspicion for decades over its nuclear ambitions and whether it’s developing the capability to fire an atomic weapon.
title: How Close Is Iran to a Nuclear Weapon as Trump Eyes a Deal?

author: Abeer Abu Omar
description: Air assault raises serious questions about the US president’s influence over America’s allies
title: Israel’s Strikes on Iran Are a Challenge to Trump

author: Marissa Newman
description: Israel prides itself on having some of the best air defenses in the world, and these billion-dollar systems have been put to the test since the Iran-backed Palestinian group Hamas provoked a new war with Israel in October 2023. Militant organizations supported by Iran have launched rockets, missiles and drones at Israel. Iran itself has struck repeatedly, most recently in June after Israel launched a major attack targeting the Islamic republic’s nuclear facilities and military leadership.
title: What are Israel’s Air Defenses Against Iran’s Missiles, Drones?

author: Upmanyu Trivedi
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s controversial tax on private school fees survived a legal challenge in a boost for the policy that was a key plank of the Labour Party’s manifesto at last year’s general election.
title: UK Government’s Tax on Private Schools Cleared by London Court

author: Michael Cohen
description: South African diplomats in Washington working to repair frayed relations with President Donald Trump are confronting an additional headache: the nation’s embassy in Washington was inundated by storm water and raw sewage, which has rendered it partially inoperable and disrupted their work.
title: South Africa Sues for Damages After Sewage Floods Its US Embassy

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: The United Nations atomic watchdog raised alarm about Israel’s overnight strike against Iranian nuclear facilities, saying the attack breaches international legal norms and risks a radiological incident that could cross borders.
title: UN Nuclear Watchdog Says ‘Deeply Concerned’ Over Israeli Strike

author: Max Ramsay
description: Sweden will reach a planned new NATO defense spending target of 5% of GDP, Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson said, joining a string of countries ramping up commitments ahead of a key summit of alliance leaders.
title: Sweden Will Hit New NATO 5% Defense Spending Goal, Premier Says

author: Arsalan Shahla
description: Israel killed Iran’s top generals in predawn attacks on Friday, paralyzing Tehran’s military decision making in what may prove to be the opening act of a prolonged war.
title: Israeli Strikes Take Out Iran Supreme Leader’s Top Generals

author: Weilun Soon
description: Shipping lines, brokers and analysts are warning of risks to key maritime thoroughfares in the Middle East after Israel’s strikes on Iran, a major escalation in a region vital to global oil supply and trade.
title: Israel’s Strikes on Iran Raise Shipping Fears Over Chokepoints

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: The United Nations atomic watchdog said there’s no indication of increased radiation levels at Iran’s main uranium-enrichment site, an early sign that Israel’s strikes haven’t penetrated the containment layers protecting the Islamic Republic’s nuclear stockpile.
title: Key Iran Nuclear Enrichment Site of Natanz Shows No Sign of Breach

author: Paul Tugwell
description: Greek grid operator IPTO SA is seeking compensation for delays to getting licenses for seabed surveys that are needed to complete what’s set to be one of the world’s largest power links.
title: Greece’s IPTO Seeks Pay for Delays to €1.9 Billion Subsea Cable

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi, Natalia Drozdiak
description: President Donald Trump had repeatedly urged Israel not to strike Iran’s nuclear sites.
title: Israel Disregards Trump With Major Attack on Iran Nuclear Sites

author: Alan Wong
description: Beijing’s national security office in Hong Kong carried out its first known joint operation with city officials, marking an expansion of China’s direct law enforcement in the financial hub.
title: China’s Security Office Flexes New Power With Hong Kong Probe

author: Josh Sisco
description: Omnicom Group Inc. and Interpublic Group have discussed with US antitrust officials not withholding online advertising for political reasons as a possible condition for winning approval to form the world’s biggest advertising agency, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: FTC Weighs Political Neutrality Pledge for Ad Agency Mega-Merger

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan’s top trade negotiator expects a trade deal with the US to spare Tokyo from higher auto tariffs, even if US President Donald Trump decides to increase them against other nations.
title: Akazawa Sees a Deal With US Sparing Japan From Higher Car Levies

description: Smoke rises from a damaged building in Tehran, Iran, early on June 13. AP Photo
title: イスラエルによるイラン攻撃と金融市場動向

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea said it successfully refloated a 5,000-ton destroyer that suffered damage in a botched launch attempt last month that left it foundering in shallow water, with leader Kim Jong Un vowing to build two more vessels of the same class next year as part of his efforts to boost the country’s naval capabilities.
title: North Korea Restores Damaged Warship, Plans Two More Next Year

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: The Trump administration must pull back on its use of military troops in Los Angeles to deal with protests over the president’s immigration raids, according to a federal judge.
title: Trump Must Stop His Use of Troops in LA Protests, Judge Says

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Former Philippine president Rodrigo Duterte has requested the International Criminal Court in The Hague for his interim release, three months after he was arrested for alleged crimes against humanity under his controversial war on drugs.
title: Philippine Ex-Leader Duterte Seeks Release From ICC Detention

description: An Iranian woman dressed in the traditional chador in downtown Tehran. Photographer: BEHROUZ MEHRI/AFP
title: Israel Launches Strikes at Iran, Braces for Retaliation

author: Patrick Sykes, Marissa Newman
description: Israel launched airstrikes on Iran, in a major escalation in the standoff over Tehran’s atomic program that risks sparking a new war in the Middle East.
title: Israel Conducts Strikes in Iran in Major Escalation
